bug.author: marcoct
bug.summary: Untraced call to a gen function should sample from the generative distribution, and not use generate
bug.description: An untraced call to a gen function should sample from its generative distribution p (e.g. which is sampled from by propose), and not q (which is sampled from by generate). Although in the most typical case this q is identical to the p when there are no constraints on generate, it is not always.

comments.comment: Nice -- I was wondering about this. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/vkmvkmvkmvkm>@vkmvkmvkmvkm</denchmark-link> , this is related to the question of whether a Metaprob , when called from Clojure, should invoke the implementation and throw away the score (as it does currently), or just invoke the model.
